 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָקַף‎</span>] **verb** ==strike off== (Late Hebrew ***strike, wound***, Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נְקַף‎</span> ***id.***; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***fregit*** caput, ut cerebrum appareret; Vulgar Arabic ***snap*** with the finger ([[BDB#Dozy|Dozy]]<sup>ii. 716</sup>); Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***na‡pu***</u></abbr> probably= ***mutilated***; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***peel, flay*** [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>649</sup>); — 

**Niph\`al** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְנִקַּף סִבְכֵי הַיַּ֫עַר‎</span> consecutive [[Isa.10.34|Isa 10:34]] and the thickets of the forest shall be ***struck away*** (on singular verb compare [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:145o»§ 145o</sup> [[BDB#Da|Da]]<sup>Synt. § 113 b</sup>; or. read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִקְּפוּ‎</span>; — form possibly Pi\`el, but compare [[BDB#Di|Di]] [[BDB#Du|Du]] [[BDB#Che|Che]]<sup>Hpt</sup>). **Pi\`el** ***Perfect*** 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְאַחַר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עוֺרִי נִקְּפוּזֹֿאת‎</span> [[Job.19.25|Job 19:25]] ***after my skin, which they*** ([[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:144g»§ 144g</sup>) ***have struck off*** (alluding to ravages of his disease) — ***this!*** but text dubious; [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּזאֹת נִקַּף‎</span> **Niph\`al** ***which has been thus struck off.*** 



 II. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָקַף‎</span> **verb**] ==go around== (intransitive), ([[Eccl.45.9|Eccl 45:9]] Hiph\`il <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ויקיפהו‎</span> ***surround something with*** (2 accusative); Perfect 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הקיפה‎</span> 43:12 (accusative+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ב‎</span> instrumental); Late Hebrew Hiph\`il <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִקִּיף‎</span> = Biblical Hebrew; also = ***cling to, be attached, joined to***, and so Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אַקֵּיף‎</span> (Aph\`el), <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); **Qal** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חַגִּים יִנְקֹ֑פוּ‎</span> [[Isa.29.1|Isa 29:1]] (figurative) ***let feasts go around***, i.e. run the round (of the year). **Hiph\`il** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִקִּיף‎</span> [[Job.19.6|Job 19:6]] 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִקִּ֫יפָהִ‎</span> [[Isa.15.8|Isa 15:8]] 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִקִּ֫יפוּ‎</span> [[Job.1.5|Job 1:5]]; [[Ps.88.18|Ps 88:18]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִקִּיפוּ‎</span> consecutive [[2Chr.23.7|2Chr 23:7]], suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִקִּיפוּנִי‎</span> [[Ps.22.17|Ps 22:17]] 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִקַּפְתֶּם‎</span> consecutive [[2Kgs.11.8|2Kgs 11:8]] ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּקַּף‎</span> [[Lam.3.5|Lam 3:5]] 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַקִּ֫יפוּ‎</span> [[Ps.17.9|Ps 17:9]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּקִּ֫פוּ‎</span> [[2Kgs.6.14|2Kgs 6:14]] 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּקִּ֫פוּ‎</span> [[Lev.19.27|Lev 19:27]] ***Imperative*** masculine plural suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַקִּיפ֫וּהָ‎</span> [[Ps.48.13|Ps 48:13]] ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַקֵּיף‎</span> [[Josh.6.3|Josh 6:3]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַקֵּף‎</span> v[[Josh.6.11|Josh 6:11]] ***Participle*** plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַקִּ(י)פִים‎</span> [[1Kgs.7.24|1Kgs 7:24]]; [[2Chr.4.3|2Chr 4:3]] — 

**1.** ***go around, surround, encompass:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** ***go around***, with accusative of city, [[Josh.6.3|Josh 6:3]] compare v[[Josh.6.11|Josh 6:11]] (accusative omitted), [[Ps.48.13|Ps 48:13]] (all \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָבָב‎</span>); also (figurative) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִקִּ֫יפָה הַזְּעָקָה אֶתֿ‎</span> [[Isa.15.8|Isa 15:8]] ***the cry hath gone about*** the border of Moab. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** ***surround, encompass, enclose***, usually with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׃עַלֿ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּקִּ֫פוּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלהָֿעִיר‎</span> [[2Kgs.6.14|2Kgs 6:14]] ***and they closed in upon the city*** (beleaguered it); with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> person [[2Kgs.11.8|2Kgs 11:8]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָבִיב‎</span>), [[Ps.17.9|Ps 17:9]]; [[Ps.88.18|Ps 88:18]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָבַב‎</span>), + accusative of thing [[Job.19.6|Job 19:6]] ***he hath closed his net in upon me*** compare [[Lam.3.5|Lam 3:5]] less often with accusative of person [[Ps.22.17|Ps 22:17]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָבַב‎</span>), [[2Chr.23.7|2Chr 23:7]] (\|\| [[2Kgs.11.8|2Kgs 11:8]] + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָבִיב‎</span>), also of inanimate things [[1Kgs.7.24|1Kgs 7:24]] = [[2Chr.4.3|2Chr 4:3]] (both + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָבִיב‎</span>, \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָבַב‎</span>). 

**2.** ***make the round***, i.e. ***complete the circuit*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְמֵי הַמִּשְׁתֶּה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִקּ‎</span> [[Job.1.5|Job 1:5]] when ***the days of feasting had completed their circuit***. 

**3.** ***make round, round off*** (literally): <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פְּאַת ראֹשְׁכֶם‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹא חַקּ‎</span> [[Lev.19.27|Lev 19:27]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹא תַשְׁחִית אֵת פְּאַת‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זְקָנֶ֑ךָ‎</span>), of heathen rite. 



 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קוף‎</span> (√of following; apparently = II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נקף‎</span>, ***go around***).
